Description: Stone footed bowl, limestone or possibly alabaster with a buff-pink surface; low cylindrical dish with vertical, slightly concave sides with three horizontal ribs; the small knob or nipple in the centre of the base is probably the remains of the original foot or else fitted into the socket of a detachable stand.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: Probably an example of a 'Tazza' bowl which has lost its foot, similar to I. Jacobsson's catalogue nos. 27-31 (Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (SIMA CXII), (Jonsered 1994), pp. 12 and 77), though this piece is much smaller.
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 79, Tomb 30 no. 4)
